key_points: Citigroup's interface confusion led to a $500 million mistake described as a major blunder in banking history.
Alex Khmelevskiy, head of UX design at Clay, criticized the outdated user interface of Citigroup's wire transfer system.
Citigroup is working to update its loan operations platform and has added significant controls until the new system is operational.
Oracle, the interface provider for Flexcube, declined to comment on the situation.
A federal judge ruled that Citigroup cannot recoup the $500 million mistakenly sent to Revlon creditors.
The mistake occurred during a process to transfer a $7.8 million interest payment, but the full loan amount was sent instead.
Flexcube, a third-party application used by Citigroup for wire transfers, was part of the procedural failure.
A subcontractor in India made the error by incorrectly checking boxes during the transaction setup.
Judge Jesse Furman hopes other banks learn from this mistake and implement steps to minimize error risks.
The judge's ruling was based on a precedent, stating it was reasonable for the creditors to keep the funds.
spokespersons: Alex Khmelevskiy (Head of UX design, Clay)
